tweets.text: Highly invasive Japanese knotweed gets shock treatment! Thanks to the Water Environment Grant the Exmoor Non-Native Invasive Species project is trialling an organically acceptable control method ‚Äì an electrical shock that boils & kills plant cells @ExmoorNP #INNSweek @InvasiveSp https://t.co/dAoDY6xmW8

Land management for maize on peat. CO2 emissions of 30+ tonnes per ha, per yr.  Land height losses of 1cm per yr.  Glyphosate spray drift has killed ditch side and emergent vegetation. Run-off from artificial fertilizer applications pollutes water courses. This needs to change. https://t.co/BBvGAeH9J4
